instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
Ok so I removed the gpu and i have no chime. I checked the tona resistor <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> 12.55v and it’s 91k. <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> ph1,2,3
.78-.9v <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_SO_AXG_L</SIGNAL>=.458v 
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_BOOT1G</SIGNAL>=4.7v is this right ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
Why did you remove the GPU so fast?
Even shorted, disabling GPU for test is very easy on this board.

VCORE looks good now, but you still need to force iGPU.
Did you check USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: Someone had previously remove and mount it sideways I just removed it and placed correctly but it was shorted. So I took it off.. Yes blinking mouse and blinking usb stick

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
Blinking USB mouse is no good...
Try this file, just in case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
Ok.
1-What would be the right usb mouse solid light ? I just wanna know for next time.
2- Also after a newer gpu “2017” is swapped and the client wanted the underfill replaced I was gonna use Loctite 3513. Because High temp silicone smells Strong so I’m hoping 3513 is better. Do you have a product Suggestion that is better ?
3-the video memory was also reflowed because there’s flux and the underfill is removed here as well. Will this cause my current issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
As I said, you should try disabling GPU first.
You must get steady light on USB mouse and video with iGPU.
If not, you have another problem on the board.

I will not waste the time changing GPU on these boards.
Explain to the client, impossible to get real new chip; you've probably soldered a refurbished one now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: Ok i was wrong it was booting I just had no chime. Weird thing is I just have no chime but the audio does work When it boot into OS X the audio works :/ . I’m not sure why I don’t get a chime I tried PRAM a few time and nothing. all I have left it to resolve no WiFi hardware installed and 1 usb isn’t working :/ thank You In advanced for any help. I’m gonna start at L3401

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: Check the small inductors placed on USB data lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: I forgot to ask. why is it not chiming ? Is it disable in nvram? Wouldn’t a PRAM reset it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
PRAM reset should bring chime back.
I remember someone else claimed about this issue last month.
However, chime matters so much?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: I’m not sure it’s not in me :/ I’m just trying to resolve all issues before it leaves so they have nothing to complain about. I found the usb issue it was <DIODE>D4600</DIODE> along with 3 vias that I ran jumpers to. All I have left is the chime so if I solve it I will post it here so maybe it can help someone else. :) thanks a lot for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: ok I found something only there 4 caps I found 28ohm short. In diode I get .028v two are tantalum <CAPACITOR>C6622</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6632</CAPACITOR>. The other two are ceramic. I was thinking that maybe that tantalum as they have a higher failed rate but at 5v I’m not sure which direction to go. At first I thought it was the chip but measurements I have around chip .489v to .520v and the gain test point measures .487 off <CHIP>U6630</CHIP> but <CHIP>U6620</CHIP> is cover with underfill so I couldn’t test all leads.  What is your honest opinion? I’m still trying to recover chime :/ oh and oddly audio does still work but only after OS X boots :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
If you have sound in macOS, audio amplifiers are good.
Unless you detect missing sound in some speaker.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U6620</CHIP> and got chime I really took my time protecting all the plastic and only burned just the upper corner of the sub connector :) I’m so glad that’s over 
Thank you informatico for all your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted gpu
threads.message: So you didn't have sound on right speaker from the beginning?
